cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest across the northwest Caribbean, cross or skirt the northern Yucatan late Monday, then accelerate north‐northwest across the central Gulf toward the north-central Gulf Coast mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast (likely SE Louisiana to MS/AL coastline)

weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued yet for U.S. Gulf Coast; current warnings limited to Yucatan Peninsula and western Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–50 mph) possible Wednesday into early Thursday with a low (1%) chance of hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge 2–4 ft above normally dry ground along the Alabama coast and into Mobile Bay if the center tracks just west of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deposit 2–4 inches with isolated amounts near or above 6 inches, producing flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands and dangerous seas in Mobile Bay and approaches.
